learning_objectives.description: Understand and use the probability scale from 0 to 1.

learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: P(A) is the probability of A. P(A') is the probability of not A.

learning_objectives.description: Calculate the probability of a single event.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Probabilities should be given as a fraction, decimal or percentage. Problems may require using information from tables, graphs or Venn diagrams.

learning_objectives.description: Understand that the probability of an event not occurring = 1 - the probability of the event occurring.
